text: Sheen Falls Lodge is a five-star, 77-room historic hotel in County Kerry, Ireland. The hotel was developed in the 1980s and opened in 1991; the property long had a historic hunting lodge from the 1700s. In the past, it housed restaurant La Cascade, that was awarded a Michelin star in the period 1993–1998. The restaurant is now called The Falls. It was sold in 2018 to a consortium of Thai investors. It occupies a property on the River Sheen, and overlooks Kenmare Bay. ==References== Category:Hotels in County Kerry Category:County Kerry Category:Hotels established in 1991 Category:Hotel buildings completed in 1991
title: Sheen Falls Lodge
